item.title: Python and R
item.description: Python and R are able to communicate with each other even though they are two different coding languages. You can use reticulate in order to have R and python chunks communicate. First, you must call reticulate using library(). Then you can create an object (I called mine “randomstring”) with some character value. library(reticulate) randomstring <- "This is a picture of" Using a python code chunk, you can actually use the same variable name and things won’t get mixed up!
